intro: Pigea volubilis, commonly known as the climbing pigeonwings, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and showy, pink to purple flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, wind-dispersed seeds. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and the stems are covered in fine, hairy hairs. Pigea volubilis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges and along stream banks.
